AfterSecondStage.Text: Looks like you have familiarized yourself with using spells to navigate and perform actions of the stage!
I think it's time you learned about using spellcodes! Head over to the Spellcodes tab
Spellcodes are a predefined sequence of spells that you can immediately use to perform certain actions much more efficiently on your action queue!
You can add spellcodes to your inventory by pressing the create button.
Let’s try to make a basic spellcode that will allow us to shoot a fireball and move forward in succession.

AddSpellcodeTab.Text: You can create and edit your spellcode in this tab.
You can edit the contents of the spellcode and the spellcode’s name.
To start off, you give the spellcode any name that you like.
Then drag the fireball spell and the move right spell into the spellcode.
Take note that the order the spells are executed in the spellcode are from left to right.
Once you’re done creating the spellcode, click on the Save button.
Always remember to apply the concept of abstraction when performing spells on the stage.
Focus on using the spells that you think are relevant in completing the stage!
You can also use this concept when creating your spellcodes!
Your created spellcodes will be displayed in your inventory below.
You can choose to edit them again if you feel like doing so by pressing the edit button.
Or you could rather delete the spellcode instead by pressing the delete button.
Let’s add the created spellcode to our equipped spellcodes by pressing the equip button.
You can also unequip your spellcodes and return them to your inventory by pressing the unequip button.
Looks like we’re ready to put our spellcode to use! Let’s head to the next stage.
